H0.text: Digestive system is complete in mollusks that have a true coelom.

H1.text: Skeletal system is the complete feature that mollusks have in addition to a true coelom.

H2.text: The nerve system is complete in mollusks that have a true coelom.

H3.text: The tissues system is the complete system that mollusks have, in addition to a true coelom.

A4.text: The mantle edge secretes a shell (secondarily absent in a number of taxonomic groups, such as the nudibranchs).

A5.text: The four most universal features defining modern molluscs are a soft body composed almost entirely of muscle, a mantle with a significant cavity used for breathing and excretion, the presence of a radula (except for bivalves), and the structure of the nervous system.
